# Fundamentals

<ul>
  <li>What is Marketing</li>
  <ul>
    <li>The study of markets</li>
    <li>The interaction between buyer and seller</li>
  </ul>
  <li>Marketing differs based on the type of market</li>
  <ul>
    <li>Seller's Market</li>
    <li>Buyer's Market</li>
  </ul>
</ul>

---

# Fundamentals

<ul>
  <li>Seller's Market</li>
  <ul>
    <li>The seller has the product</li>
    <li>The buyer must come to the seller to get the product</li>
    <li class = "red">Product Focused Marketing</li>
    <li>Source of profit: lower cost, market to everyone; sell to everyone</li>
  </ul>
</ul>

Is "traditional" reserving work a seller's market?
--

(SEC filer v non-SEC Filer?)
---

# Fundamentals

<ul>
<li>Buyer's Market</li>
  <ul>
    <li>Identify customer needs</li>
    <li>Deliver product that meets the needs of the customer</li>
    <li class = "red">Customer Focused Marketing</li>
    <li>Every customer has different needs</li>
    <li>Marketing needs to be segmented</li>
    <li>Sources of profit: cross-selling, loyalty</li> 
  </ul>
</ul>  

---
# Market Driven Principles

<ul>
  <li>Know your market</li>
  <li>How do buyers select sellers</li>
  <ul>
    <li>Operational (price, delivery, service reliability)</li>
    <li>Features and Design</li>
    <li>Meeting Customer Needs</li>
  </ul>
  <li>Commit to being first in the markets that you serve</li>
    <ul>
    <li>Be the best in one area</li>
    <li>Offer fair value in the other areas</li>
    </ul>
  <li>Guarantee customer satisfaction</li>
</ul>

---
# The Four P's of Marketing

<ul>
  <li>Product - What the seller puts into the exchange</li>
  <li>Place - The way that the seller delivers product to the customer</li>
  <li>Promotion - Communication of Benefit</li>
  <li>Price - What the buyer puts into the exchange</li>
</ul>

---
# Execution of Marketing

### Marketing Strategy | Product

<ul>
  <li>Define a market segment</li>
  <li>Determine how we will compete in that market</li>
  <li>Execute</li>
</ul>
